structure.unit: SOVEREIGNTY AND JURISDICTION OF THE COMMONWEALTH
GRANTS TO UNITED STATES OF LANDS AND RIGHTS TO ACQUIRE

law.catch_line: Consent to retrocession of jurisdiction by United States.
law.text: Except as otherwise provided in KRS 3.255 to 3.275, the Commonwealth consents to any retrocession by the United States of lands within its geographical boundaries whenever the United States shall have ceased to exercise exclusive or special jurisdiction over such lands. Inter alia, the conveyance of lands to private owners shall be deemed to constitute a retrocession of jurisdiction.
law.history: Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 68, sec. 8, effective June 17, 1978. -- Created 1954 Ky. Acts ch. 217, sec. 4, effective June 17, 1954.
